newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan closes down at intra-day low vs US dollar.
newsitem.headline: Yuan closes down at intra-day low vs US dollar.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed down at an intra-day low of 8.2935 against the U.S. dollar on Monday from last Friday's 8.2928 on speculative selling just ahead of the close, traders said.
The yuan opened slightly lower at 8.2930 and moved in a narrow range around the opening level for most of the session, hitting an intra-day high of 8.2874 late in trading.
Trading was dull with most done at about 8.2930, traders said.
One dealer said the fall ahead of the close had little impact on the yuan's upward trend in the short term.
"It will not affect the strong pro-yuan sentiment before the Chinese Lunar New Year holiday," he added.
He said he expected the yuan to rise up to move above 8.2930 on Tuesday.
The yuan closed down at 6.8270 from 6.8080 against 100 Japanese yen and up at 1.0693 from 1.0703 against the Hong Kong dollar.
